content.description: See the huge jugs that go straight up this beautiful face of rock?  Climb those.  When they run out, pull the lip (the crux) and press it out to the top.  Top rope anchoring discusses below.
content.protection:
A top rope can be anchored with some mid-sized to smallish cams and tricams at the top of this boulder - it's easy to scramble up the left side of the boulder. 

  Or you could climb it as a boulder problem and just not fall (crux is at the top on slopers).
content.location: 50 feet north along the ridge past The Trembling, large obvious pinnacle.

content.description: Start sitting, matched in the obvious jug on the right side of the face. Climb up and just to the left of the 'bulge' feature.  Top out using flat slopers above the bulge.  Yes you have to go all the way to to the top of the boulder.  It's worth it!
content.location: Large obvious jug low on the far right side of the Trembling Boulder.

content.description: Sit start as The Tremblings and traverse boulder from right to left.  Step off after rounding the arete or continue up through the corridor for some sketchy fun!
content.location: Right to Left traverse of the Trembling boulder starting on the right side of the face.

content.description: Left side of the face of the boulder. Start standing at the large surfboard-like rail at chest height. With your left hand on a flat crimp, step up and grab a smallish sidepull with your right hand. Top out straight up using the slopers above.
content.location: Left side of the boulder face.  Starting holds at chest height.
